string.text: Ammo parts

Even with good supplies, it’s not uncommon to end up with one or more cartridges of what might be considered as “bad” ammunition. Unlucky stalkers might find themselves in very bad situations when their weapons jam at critical moments due to bad cartridges. On the contrary, these ammo parts can be reused for the creation of better variants. That's why some stalkers prefer to keep them around.\n \n
Paper sheets
Torn sheets of silk coated paper. Even in a place like the Zone, it can be used for all kind of things. The cheapest way for packaging food or cleaning dirt.\n \n
Textolite base
Layered plastic based on fabric of fibers and polymeric binder (bakelite, polyester resin, epoxy resin). With proper skill it can be great help in repairing.\n \n
Cloth sheet
Simple cloth sheet, commonly used both to patch clothing and spread oils and cleaning solvents onto firearm mechanisms. Can be applied by any needle or glue.\n \n
Textile sheet

Sheet of military-grade textile that can be used for field repairs of clothing and light armor. Valued for its relatively low price and high versatility, this material is commonly used by the Zoners. Medium-grade sewing equipment and advanced glue required for use. It can also be used to improve spread of liquids during weapon maintenance.\n \n
Reinforced textile sheet

Thick textile patch reinforced with kevlar padding. Can be used to repair medium and heavy armors. Large enough to cover multiple damaged areas. High quality sewing kits and adhesives are required to make use of it. Its alternative usage is weapon lubrication and cleaning - due to increased hardness it's able reach even less accessible areas of firearm parts.\n \n
A pack of capacitors

Electric capacitors can store electricity. The simplest capacitor consists of two metal plates and a dielectric between them. It is a main component is most of electrical devices due to its important job in rectifying alternative current, storing electrical energy and bypassing noise. They are quite rare in the Zone, but they are very useful.\n \n
A box of transistors

A box of high-quality BJT transistors. A transistor consists of three Semiconductor parts (base, emitter, collector) that serve together to generate, convert and amplify electrical oscillations. The ultimate dream of electronics engineers, if such a miracle will bring to the Area.\n \n
A box of resistors

Resistors are the most common electronics components found in electronics. They limit and direct the passage of electrical current through circuit's branches to ensure other components are getting proper voltage feeding. This box contains a good set of resistors with different resistance values and tolerance, ranging from 12 up to 82M ohms.\n \n
Copper wire

Electrotechnical copper wire is used practically in all devices, devices, apparatuses, installations, machines where the production, transmission or use of electric energy occurs. In its pure form it is rare, but if necessary it can be easily extracted from common old radios, walkie-talkies and other electronics.\n \n
Wooden parts
Pieces of wide-grained, light cedar wood. Mostly used for outdoor projects such as furniture, decks and tools. White it's not that useful in a place like the Zone, it could be used in crafting.\n \n
Metallic scrap

Handful of metal bits and pieces of equipment. A variety of many different types and grades of steel and aluminum alloys. Could be used to aid in repairing gear in the field, or perhaps even in crafting.\n \n
Fasteners

Handful of screws, washers, nuts, nails and small pieces of metallic plates. A variety of many different types and sizes. Could be used to aid in repairing gear in the field, or perhaps even in crafting.\n \n
Plastic film

A small pack made of low density polyethylene film. These thin plastic membranes are used to separate areas or volumes, hold items and act as barriers. Plastic films are used in a wide variety of applications. Despite being partly torn, polyethylene's characteristics makes it a great solution for packaging and isolating, especially for food and medicine.\n \n
Glass pieces
Ceramic base
Leather roll
Rubber
Trigger mechanism

The trigger mechanism and assembly from an unknown firearm. Most triggers are very similar, and there's no reasno this one couldn't be shaved down to fit almost any weapon.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] basic material
Spring

A small spring from either the trigger assembly or inner workings of an unknown firearm. Could probably be adapted to replace most any small spring.
 
%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] basic material
Pistol grip

Pistol grips from some unknown weapon. This rubberized handle could probably be shaped or molded to fit almost any firearm.
 
%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] basic material
18.5mm barrel [R]
barrel from an 18.5mm double-barrel shotgun.\n \n
18.5mm barrel [R]
barrel from an 18.5mm cock double-barrel shotgun.\n \n
18.5mm barrel [K]
barrel from an 18.5mm smooth-bore rifle.\n \n
7.62mm barrel [V]
barrel from a 7.62mm rifle.\n \n
7.92mm barrel [V]
barrel from a German 7.92mm rifle.\n \n
9mm barrel-silencer [AS/PP]
barrel with an integrated silencer from an automatic special purpose 9mm rifle.\n \n
7.62mm barrel [A|V]
barrel from a semi-automatic or automatic 7.62mm rifle.\n \n
5.45mm barrel [À]
barrel from an automatic 5.45mm rifle.\n \n
5.56mm barrel [À]
barrel from an automatic 5.56mm rifle.\n \n
7.62mm barrel [P]
barrel from a 7.62mm rifle with a gas regulator.\n \n
9mm barrel [AS/PP]
barrel from an automatic special purpose 9mm or PP rifle.\n \n
7.62mm barrel [PP]
barrel from the infamous or even legendary PPSh submachine gun system.\n \n
12.7x55mm barrel
barrel from an automatic 12.7x55mm rifle.\n \n
Single-mode hammer type trigger
Single-mode hammer type trigger mechanism.\n \n
Double fire mode trigger mechanism with hammer
Dual-mode hammer type trigger. Designed for the conduct of automatic and single fire.\n \n
Triple fire mode trigger mechanism with hammer
Triple fire mode hammer type trigger. Designed for the conduct of automatic, single and double fire. Strongly tied to the design of the weapon.\n \n
Single fire mode trigger mechanism with firing pin
Single fire mode trigger mechanism with firing pin.\n \n
Double fire mode trigger mechanism with firing pin
Double fire mode trigger mechanism with firing pin. Allows shooting in single and automatic fire.\n \n
Trigger mechanism with hammer [R]
Trigger mechanism with hammer from a double-barrel shotgun.\n \n
Sliding bolt carrier with turning bolt lock [Russia]
Sliding bolt carrier with a turning bolt lock, produced by Eastern manufacturers.\n \n
Sliding bolt carrier with turning bolt lock [Russia]
Sliding bolt carrier with turning bolt lock, produced by Eastern manufacturers, from special automatic weapons.\n \n
Sliding bolt carrier with turning bolt lock [NATO]
Longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn, produced by NATO, from an standard calibre automatic rifle.\n \n
Sliding bolt carrier with a locking bias
Sliding bolt carrier with a locking bias.\n \n
Half-free sliding bolt carrier
Half-free sliding bolt carrier with a roller brake.\n \n
Sliding bolt carrier with locking bolt
Sliding bolt carrier with locking bolt.\n \n
Lever type bolt carrier with locking wedge
Lever type bolt carrier with locking wedge.\n \n
Chock from double-barrel shotgun [R]
Chock from double-barrel shotgun.\n \n
Chock from a double-barrel shotgun [R]
Chock from a double-barrel shotgun.\n \n
Sliding bolt carrier with turning bolt lock [NATO]
Sliding bolt carrier with turning bolt lock, product of NATO countries for a large-calibre automatic rifle.\n \n
Longitudinal-a sliding free bolt carrier [PP]
Sliding free bolt carrier from a submachine gun.\n \n
Dropping-block breech [R]
Dropping-block breech from a smooth-bore shotgun or rifle with lever locking mechanism. In appearance, the ledges of the wedge are in good condition, without strong workings\n \n
Rotating locking head [2 locks][P]
Rotating locking head with two stops from a machine gun with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn. In appearance, locking heads are in good condition, without big signs of usage.\n \n
Rotating locking head [2 locks][K]
Rotating locking head with two stops from either automatic or semi-automatic smoothbore rifle, with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Rotating locking head [2 locks][V]
Rotating locking head with two stops from a rifle with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with a locking bias and a longitudinally-sliding shutter with a "bolt" lock.\n \n
Rotating locking head [3 locks][V]
Rotating locking head with two stops from a rifle with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Rotating locking head [2 locks][À]
Rotating locking head with two stops from a machine gun with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Rotating locking head [4 locks][AS]
Rotating locking head with four locks from a special automatic rifle with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Rotating locking head [6 locks][À]
Rotating locking head with six locks from a machine gun with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Rotating locking head [7 locks][À]
Rotating locking head with seven locks from a machine gun with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Rotating locking head [8 locks][À]
Rotating locking head with eight locks from a machine gun with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Supercharger with hammer from a double-barrel shotgun [R]
Right and left supercharger with hammer from a double-barrel shotgun.\n \n
Hammers from a hammer-type double-barrel shotgun [R]
Right and left hammers from the double-barrelled horizontal shotgun.\n \n
Rotating locking head [2 locks][À][NATO]
Rotating locking head with two stops from a large-calibre automatic rifle produced by NATO countries with a sliding bolt carrier with turning bolt lock.\n \n
Rotating locking head [À/PP]
Rotating locking head from either the PP or an automatic rifle with a longitudinal-a half-free sliding bolt carrier.\n \n
Drummer with the mainspring [PP]
Drummer with the mainspring from some domestic PP with a longitudinal-a sliding free bolt carrier.\n \n
Drummer with the mainspring [PP][NATO]
Drummer with the mainspring from some imported PP with a longitudinal-a sliding free bolt carrier.\n \n
Drummer with the mainspring [PP][PPSh]
Drummer with the mainspring from some Soviet PP, like the PP of Shpagin’s system with a longitudinal-a sliding free bolt carrier.\n \n
Gas tube [K]
Gas tube from a smoothbore carbine.\n \n
Handguard [R]
mobile hand guard from pump-action shotgun.\n \n
Gas tube [V]
Gas tube from a self-loading rifle.\n \n
Gas tube [AS/PP]
Gas tube from a special automatic rifle. 9mm.\n \n
Gas tube [A|V][Russia]
Gas tube from a semi-automatic or automatic rifle (Russia).\n \n
Gas tube [A|V][NATO]
Gas tube from a semi-automatic or automatic rifle (NATO).\n \n
Gas tube [P]
Gas tube from a machine gun.\n \n
Ejector [V]
Ejector from a rifle with a sliding bolt carrier with locking bolt.\n \n
Ejector from over-under double-barrel shotgun [R]
Ejector (extractor) from an over-under double barrel shotgun.\n \n
Ejector from an over-under double barrel shotgun [R]
Ejector from an over-under double barrel shotgun.\n \n
Gas tube [PP]
Gas tube from the MP5 submachine gun with a handle.\n \n
9x18mm barrel
9x19mm barrel
.45 barrel
5.7mm barrel
7.62mm barrel
9x18mm barrel (enclosed)
.357 barrel
Single-action trigger mechanism
Double-action trigger mechanism
Double-action (DA/SA) trigger mechanism
"MP412" double-action trigger mechanism
9mm recoil spring assembly [Soviet]
9mm recoil spring assembly [Russian]
.45 recoil spring assembly
9mm recoil spring assembly [Western]
7.62mm recoil spring assembly
Recoil Spring Assembly (R1 DE 6")
Cloth sheets

The very base of an outfit. These sheets are made of different materials such as cotton, polycotton, wool and leather to provide comfort and durability. Other protective fabrics are used like rubber and ballistic nylon, along with joint protections and a set of hardware and zippers.
Cloth sheets (synthetic)

The very base of an outfit. These textiles blended with synthetic materials such as polyester and lycra to provide versatility and durability. Other protective fabrics are used like rubber and ballistic nylon, along with joint protections and a set of hardware and zippers.
Durable textiles

These sheets are made of different materials such as polyester, leather and canvas, including a set of hardware and zippers. Good durability in harsh environmental conditions, which is why such materials are suitable for traveling even inside the Zone.
Mil-Spec textiles

Sheets of military-grade textiles are often used for field clothing and light armor. Valued for its relatively low price and high versatility, this material is commonly used by the Zoners. Other protective fabrics are used like rubber and ballistic nylon, along with joint protections and a set of hardware and zippers.
Layered fire retardant fabrics

These textiles that are naturally more resistant to fire than others through chemical treatment or manufactured fireproof fibers. In the Zone, such fabrics are commonly used in outfits to provide protection against hazardous environment and flame-based anomalies such as Burner and Comet.
Layered chemical/shock retardant fabrics

These textiles that are more resistant to electric shock and chemical particles than others through chemical treatment or manufactured fireproof fibers. In the Zone, such fabrics are commonly used in outfits to provide protection against hazardous environment and chemical/shock-based anomalies such as Electro and Fruit Punch.
Grade-B RPVC treated fabrics
Rigid Polyvinyl Chloride ( RPVC ) is a non-flammable material that is resistant to weathering. RPVC can also be UV stabilized to provide higher protection against anomolous hazards.
Grade-A RPVC vinyl fabrics
Rigid Polyvinyl Chloride ( RPVC ) is a non-flammable material that is resistant to weathering. RPVC can also be UV stabilized to provide higher protection against anomolous hazards.
PVC/Rubber coated fabrics

A tough and durable PVC coated polyester and rubber-fibre fabric designed for use in providing protection against hazards. It can be sewn, glued or welded. \nDouble coated material which has an extremely tough core polyester fabric and is coated on both sides with pvc.
PVC/carbon-fibre fabrics

A tough and durable PVC coated polyester and carbon-fibre fabric designed for use in providing protection against hazards. It can be sewn, glued or welded. \nDouble coated material which has an extremely tough core polyester fabric and is coated on both sides with pvc.
Insulating magnesium grid and inserts
This magnesium grid acts as dielectric layers to protect the outfit and it's wearer from powerful electic shocks and psi-waves to a certain extent. It can also offer protection against other hazards.
Insulating reinforced magnesium-oxide grid
This magnesium grid acts as dielectric layers to protect the outfit and it's wearer from powerful electic shocks and psi-waves to a certain extent. It can also offer protection against other hazards.
Polymer sheets (bismuth-sulfate coating)

The thermal degradation behaviour of bismuth-sulfate makes it a great choice for oufits used inside the Zone. Usually coated on polymer sheets for considerable body coverage. It can provide protection against other types of hazards.
Polymer sheets (barium-sulfate coating)

The thermal degradation behaviour of barium-sulfate makes it a great choice for oufits used inside the Zone. Usually coated on polymer sheets for considerable body coverage. It can provide protection against other types of hazards.
Aluminized layers of retardant fabrics

Multilayer Aluminized fabrics are specifically designed for protective apparel and shields used in environments that pose serious fire risk or safety hazards associated with radiant heat and chemical sources. In addition, these fabrics offer great isolatation against psi-waves effects.
Aluminized fiberglass fabrics

Multilayer Aluminized fiberglass fabrics are specifically designed for protective apparel and shields used in environments that pose serious shock risk or safety hazards associated with radiant heat and chemical sources. In addition, these fabrics offer great isolatation against psi-waves effects.
PBI-blended fabrics

PBI-blended fabrics have been trusted in the fire service over the years. Recognized as the leading high-performance protective fire resistant fabrics. For this reason, Zoners took advantage of these fabrics for their own outfits.
PBI-blended fabrics w/ polyester treatment

PBI-blended fabrics have been trusted in the fire service over the years. Recognized as the leading high-performance protective fire resistant fabrics. For this reason, Zoners took advantage of these fabrics for their own outfits.
Activated carbon cloth (ACC) fabrics

Originally developed for use in chemical warfare suits. Activated Carbon Cloth now has many relevant uses in defense, industrial, and medical applications. It considerably enhances the efficacy of both advanced and active wound dressings, along with providing great protection from radiation particles.
Active charcoal-treated non-woven fabrics

Originally developed for use in chemical warfare suits. Activated Carbon Cloth now has many relevant uses in defense, industrial, and medical applications. It considerably enhances the efficacy of both advanced and active wound dressings, along with providing great protection from radiation particles.
Insulating constantan inserts

Theses inserts made of constantan sheets. They acts as dielectric layers to protect the outfit and it's wearer from electic shocks, psi-waves and radioactive materials to a certain extent. It can also offer protection against other hazards, which is why they found their use inside the Zone.
Insulating constantan inserts w/ fiberglass coating

Theses inserts made of constantan sheets and fiberglass-coated fabrics. They acts as dielectric layers to protect the outfit and it's wearer from electic shocks, psi-waves and radioactive materials to a certain extent. It can also offer protection against other hazards, which is why they found their use inside the Zone.
Insulating fibreglass "Polyester" fabrics

High temperature resistant fabrics woven from “E" glass fibers and coated with Vermiculite based film providing extended service temperatures up to 1500°F and good shock resistance up to 20Kv. In a place like the Zone, these fabrics can come in handy against anomolous hazards.
Insulating fibreglass "Satin Weave" fabrics

High temperature resistant fabrics woven from “E" glass fibers and coated with Vermiculite based film providing extended service temperatures up to 1700°F and good shock resistance up to 25Kv. In a place like the Zone, these fabrics can come in handy against anomolous hazards.
Kevlar k129 plates w/ reinforced ceramic inserts

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, and are highly valued because of this feature. They perform a wide variety of functions, the most important of which is absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles on the front and the back of the torso. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel plates. Additionally, any type of armour plating also helps maintain suits in good condition, preventing degradation through wear and tear. Used by military units the world over.
Kevlar Protera plates w/ reinforced ceramic inserts

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, and are highly valued because of this feature. They perform a wide variety of functions, the most important of which is absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles on the front and the back of the torso. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel plates. Additionally, any type of armour plating also helps maintain suits in good condition, preventing degradation through wear and tear. Used by military units the world over.
Kevlar K129 plates w/ Polycarbonate composite

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, and are highly valued because of this feature. They perform a wide variety of functions, the most important of which is absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles on the front and the back of the torso. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel plates. Additionally, any type of armour plating also helps maintain suits in good condition, preventing degradation through wear and tear. Used by military units the world over.

They perform a wide variety of functions, the most important of which is absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles on the front and the back of the torso. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel plates. Additionally, any type of armour plating also helps maintain suits in good condition, preventing degradation through wear and tear. Used by military units the world over.
Kevlar AP and steel plates

They perform a wide variety of functions, the most important of which is absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles on the front and the back of the torso. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel plates. Additionally, any type of armour plating also helps maintain suits in good condition, preventing degradation through wear and tear. Used by military units the world over.

They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel plates. Additionally, any type of armour plating also helps maintain suits in good condition, preventing degradation through wear and tear. Used by military units the world over.
Kevlar K119 plates w/ Polycarbonate inserts

They perform a wide variety of functions, the most important of which is absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles on the front and the back of the torso. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel plates. Additionally, any type of armour plating also helps maintain suits in good condition, preventing degradation through wear and tear. Used by military units the world over.
Kevlar K119 plates w/ carbon-fibre inserts

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, and are highly valued because of this feature. They perform a wide variety of functions, the most important of which is absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles on the front and the back of the torso. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel plates. Additionally, any type of armour plating also helps maintain suits in good condition, preventing degradation through wear and tear. Used by military units the world over.
Grade-B polyethylene plates w/ expanded carrier

Polyethylene plates that provide extra protection to vital areas. These hard armor plates have proven effective against all handgun bullets and a range of rifles. These upgraded ballistic vests have become standard in military use, as soft body armor vests are ineffective against military rifle rounds.
Grade-A polyethylene plates w/ expanded carrier

Polyethylene plates that provide extra protection to vital areas. These hard armor plates have proven effective against all handgun bullets and a range of rifles. These upgraded ballistic vests have become standard in military use, as soft body armor vests are ineffective against military rifle rounds.
Kevlar K119 plates

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, and are highly valued because of this feature. They perform a wide variety of functions, the most important of which is absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles on the front and the back of the torso. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel plates. Additionally, any type of armour plating also helps maintain suits in good condition, preventing degradation through wear and tear. Used by military units the world over.
Reinforced Kevlar K119 plates

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, and are highly valued because of this feature. They perform a wide variety of functions, the most important of which is absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles on the front and the back of the torso. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel plates. Additionally, any type of armour plating also helps maintain suits in good condition, preventing degradation through wear and tear. Used by military units the world over.
Polyethylene lightweight armor plates

Polyethylene plates that provide extra protection to vital areas. These hard armor plates have proven effective against all handgun bullets and a range of rifles. These upgraded ballistic vests have become standard in military use, as soft body armor vests are ineffective against military rifle rounds.
Polyethylene armor plates (Improvised)

Polyethylene plates that provide extra protection to vital areas. These hard armor plates have proven effective against all handgun bullets and a range of rifles. These upgraded ballistic vests have become standard in military use, as soft body armor vests are ineffective against military rifle rounds.
Carbon nanotube layers w/ Kevlar-49 fabrics

Carbon nanotubes (CNTs) have great potential applications in making ballistic-resistance materials. The remarkable properties of CNTs makes them an ideal candidate for reinforcing polymers and other materials, and it's used in applications such as bullet-proof vests.
Carbon nanotube layers w/ Kevlar-29 fabrics (Reinforced)

Carbon nanotubes (CNTs) have great potential applications in making ballistic-resistance materials. The remarkable properties of CNTs makes them an ideal candidate for reinforcing polymers and other materials, and it's used in applications such as bullet-proof vests.
Polyethylene fibre layers w/ Polycarbonate inserts

Polyethylene plates that provide extra protection to vital areas. These hard armor plates have proven effective against all handgun bullets and a range of rifles. These upgraded ballistic vests have become standard in military use, as soft body armor vests are ineffective against military rifle rounds.
Reinforced polyethylene fibre layers

Polyethylene plates that provide extra protection to vital areas. These hard armor plates have proven effective against all handgun bullets and a range of rifles. These upgraded ballistic vests have become standard in military use, as soft body armor vests are ineffective against military rifle rounds.
Carbon fibre layers

As compared to Kevlar material carbon fiber is little different and is not very effective against the sharp materials. But the advantage of carbon fiber is that it can stand high temperatures while Kevlar starts to weaken in this area. The materials made of carbon fiber tend to be light, therefore it offers more flexibility.
Reinforced carbon fibre layers

As compared to Kevlar material carbon fiber is little different and is not very effective against the sharp materials. But the advantage of carbon fiber is that it can stand high temperatures while Kevlar starts to weaken in this area. The materials made of carbon fiber tend to be light, therefore it offers more flexibility.
Exoskeleton frame
Mechanical frame powered by a system of electric motors, pneumatics, levers and hydraulics that give the wearer both superior protection as well as greatly increased physical strength.
